meanings.definition: The invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen.
meanings.sent1: The fresh air in the park felt cool on my face.
meanings.sent2: Breathing in clean air is important for our health.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy chased after the air blown from the fan.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as fresh and invigorating as a gust of air on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The smell of flowers in the garden wafted through the air, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To expose to the circulation of fresh air.
meanings.sent1: Please air out the room to get rid of the musty smell.
meanings.sent2: After painting, it's important to air the room to let the fumes dissipate.
meanings.sent3: She decided to air her grievances with her boss during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The author wanted to air his thoughts on the current political situation.
meanings.sent5: Opening the windows will help to air out the stuffy classroom and make it more comfortable.

meanings.definition: To be exposed to the open air.
meanings.sent1: The laundry needs to air dry in the sun.
meanings.sent2: It's refreshing to air out the blankets on a breezy day.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter needed to air before baking to achieve the right texture.
meanings.sent4: The secret finally came to air during the family reunion.
meanings.sent5: The old books were left to air on the balcony to prevent them from getting musty.
